docs.lead_paragraph: A man and a pregnant woman were stabbed last night in an attack on a subway train in Manhattan, the police said. The victims were treated at St. Vincent's Hospital Manhattan and released.

headline.main: Man and Pregnant Woman Stabbed on Subway Train

docs.abstract: Edward Murphy is charged with assault and criminal possession of weapon after allegedly stabbing Danny Aguiar and unidentified pregnant woman on New York City subway at West 4th Street station; victims are treated at hospital and released (S)
docs.snippet: A man and a pregnant woman were stabbed last night in an attack on a subway train in Manhattan, the police said.

docs.lead_paragraph: It came as a big surprise when Gittel Willner suffered her first bout of hay fever at the age of 47. ''I never had allergies before,'' said Mrs. Willner, now 53 and living in Brooklyn. ''I remember thinking, How could this happen?''

headline.main: For Adults, Allergies Bring a Surprising Twist

docs.abstract: Experts say that adult-onset allergies are on rise in United States; hold that causes could include imbalanced immune system or increased exposure to indoor allergens; explain that adult allergy sufferers may never be treated for symptoms, either because they do not recognize they have allergies or because they are resistant to taking medication because of fear of unwanted side effects; treatment options discussed; drawing (M)
docs.snippet: It came as a big surprise when Gittel Willner suffered her first bout of hay fever at the age of 47.     ''I never had allergies before,'' said Mrs. Willner, now 53 and living in Brooklyn. ''I remember thinking, How could this happen?''

docs.lead_paragraph: RECENTLY Sesame Workshop, the people behind ''Sesame Street,'' released a series of DVD's aimed at babies as young as 6 months, and I cannot begin to fathom what all the fuss is about. Oh, I know -- according to the American Academy of Pediatrics, no television is appropriate for children under 2. But doctors, where have you been? ''Teletubbies'' (target audience: viewers 1 to 3) has been entertaining our nation's infants for a decade, and Disney's ''Baby Einstein'' (birth to 2) has been educating our youngest consumers since hours after their conception. Someone's got to say it: too little, too late, Sesame Workshop. Our modern babies are pretty much born with the ability to distinguish among the ''Goldberg'' Variations and make a convincing argument for saving the rain forest. Do you really think watching Baby Elmo play wiggle and giggle during bath time is enough to engage an 8-month-old with a basic knowledge of Wordsworth?
docs.snippet: Why should I drop 10 bucks on a DVD when I have on-demand cable, where there exist quality programs that both parents and their children can enjoy together?

docs.lead_paragraph: Last September, I elected to induce labor to give birth to my son, but it was not convenience or discomfort that prompted me to do so (Tina Cassidy, March 26). In the two years since I gave birth to my first child, my obstetrics practice lost its director and half of its attending physicians to positions outside my city and state. My lack of confidence in the experience or staffing level of the physicians on call caused me to have labor induced when my obstetrician would be present for the delivery. I believe I made the right decision, but found induction to be a cold substitute for natural labor. My experience gave me first-hand knowledge of the real effects of the medical malpractice crisis that plagues Pennsylvania. Christine Carlson Philadelphia
docs.abstract: Christine Carlson letter comments on March 26 article on induced labor
